alert.note: Alert for Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:50PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Wasatch and central Utah Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 449 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Palmyra, or near Provo, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Provo, Payson, Orem, Lehi, Spanish Fork, Pleasant Grove, Springville, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Mapleton, Bluffdale, Salem, Elk Ridge, Woodland Hills, Vineyard, Brigham Young University, Palmyra, Lake Shore and Benjamin. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 249 and 285. US Route 6 between mile markers 174 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs
